Subject: Purge older detections to get Disk space back on SQL Server
Description:
HI, we have an issue with our sql server keep filling up.  The data is collected for the stealtaudit (11.5) onto there.  We have a script created that purged the data for the NVmonitorData down to 7 months, but the Stealthaudit DB just keeps growing.  Is there a setting anywhere I can change, to cut the amount kept for the Stealthaudit down, so we can keep some space on the disk for the SQL server?

Apologies if this is not clear, I can explain more with screenshots if needs be?

kind regards

Gary Atherton

East Lancashire Hospitals NHS Trust
Solution_Comment__c:
Leaving a summary of our investigation to perform the following actions:

1. Expand the disk drive sizes for the recommended values for NEA, NTP (SI), and NTM (SD).
2. Exclude the "dsm_ism_srvmgr.exe" process from the "LSASS Guardian" policy to significantly reduce the event noise and positively affect the database size.
